title: Florence Rock
text:
Florence Rock () is a rock long with a smaller rock off its northeast end, lying southwest of <a href="Cape%20Anderson">Cape Anderson</a>, off the south coast of <a href="Laurie%20Island">Laurie Island</a> in the <a href="South%20Orkney%20Islands">South Orkney Islands</a>. It was charted and named by the <a href="Scottish%20National%20Antarctic%20Expedition">Scottish National Antarctic Expedition</a>, 1902–04, led by <a href="W.S.%20Bruce">W.S. Bruce</a>.
It is probable that Bruce named Florence Rock after <a href="Edwin%20Florence">Edwin Florence</a>, chief cook on the expedition ship the "Scotia", who was promoted to first steward in <a href="Buenos%20Aires">Buenos Aires</a> in January 1904.
